Pictophonetic: 夾 indicates the sound; 犭 (dog) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
狹窄 [ xiá zhǎi ]: narrow
狹隘 [ xiá ài ]: narrow; tight; narrow minded; lacking in experience
狹小 [ xiá xiǎo ]: narrow
狹義 [ xiá yì ]: narrow sense; restricted sense
狹長 [ xiá cháng ]: long and narrow
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 犭 [ quǎn ] dog
    • 夾 [ jiā ] to support; to be wedged between
heisig_chinese_memo: When I call out, my narrow formation of sled dogs press from both sides and run faster.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: between (夾) the dogs (犭) it's narrow
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In a narrow space, a brave man holds off PACK OF WILD DOGS with only a pair of SCISSORS.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " dog " and " pinch ", the original meaning is that the horizontal distance is small, that is, " narrow ", as opposed to " wide " and " wide ". "Mo Zi‧ Bei Tu": "We put the Tumen inside to make the Dumen wide and narrow."

" Narrow " can mean small and few. "Han Feizi-Difficulty One": "Anyone who asks questions is right because of the urgency of the little one. If the question is tall, but the question is humble and narrow, the master will not suffer."

" Narrow " also means to underestimate and contempt. "Shu-Xian Yi De": "There is no self-expansion but narrow people." Kong Yingdashu: "Don't think that you know is big, and that what you know is small."

" Xia " also means urgency and urgency. "The Book of Rites‧The Book of Music": "Broadness is to tolerate traitors, while narrowness is desire." Zheng Xuan's note: "Broadness is that the voice is slow, and narrow is that the voice is urgent."

" Narrow " also means narrow-minded or insightful. Jin Gehong's "Baopuzi·Weizhi": "The study of husband affairs is not as good as choosing a teacher. The teacher is very narrow and doesn't want to teach it. The reason is that there is not much to do."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " dog " and " clip ", the original meaning is that the horizontal distance is small, that is, " narrow ", as opposed to " wide " and " wide ".
humanum_full_description:
從「犬」，「夾」聲，本義為橫的距離小，即「窄」，與「寬」、「廣」相對。《墨子‧備突》：「維置突門內，使度門廣狹。」

　　「狹」可表示小、少。《韓非子‧難一》：「凡對問者，有因問小大緩急而對也。所問高大，而對以卑狹，則明主弗受也。」

　　「狹」也表示小看、輕視。《書‧咸有一德》：「無自廣以狹人。」孔穎達疏：「勿自以所知為大，謂彼所知為小。」

　　「狹」還表示促、急迫。《禮記‧樂記》：「廣則容姦，狹則思欲。」鄭玄注：「廣謂聲緩也，狹謂聲急也。」

　　「狹」還指見識或心胸狹隘。晉葛洪《抱樸子‧微旨》：「夫務學不如擇師，師所聞素狹，又不盡情以教之，因告云：為道不在多也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「犬」，「夾」聲，本義為橫的距離小，即「窄」，與「寬」、「廣」相對。

從「 犬 」，「 夾 」聲，本義為橫的距離小，即「 窄 」，與「 寬 」、「 廣 」相對。《墨子‧備突》：「維置突門內，使度門廣狹。」 「 狹 」可表示小、少。《韓非子‧難一》：「凡對問者，有因問小大緩急而對也。所問高大，而對以卑狹，則明主弗受也。」 「 狹 」也表示小看、輕視。《書‧咸有一德》：「無自廣以狹人。」孔穎達疏：「勿自以所知為大，謂彼所知為小。」 「 狹 」還表示促、急迫。《禮記‧樂記》：「廣則容姦，狹則思欲。」鄭玄注：「廣謂聲緩也，狹謂聲急也。」 「 狹 」還指見識或心胸狹隘。晉葛洪《抱樸子‧微旨》：「夫務學不如擇師，師所聞素狹，又不盡情以教之，因告云：為道不在多也。」
From the sound of " dog" and " pinch", the original meaning is that the horizontal distance is small, that is, " narrow", as opposed to " wide" and " wide". "Mo Zi‧ Bei Tu": "We put the Tumen inside to make the Dumen wide and narrow." " Narrow" can mean small and few. "Han Feizi-Difficulty One": "Anyone who asks questions is right because of the urgency of the little one. If the question is tall, but the question is humble and narrow, the master will not suffer." " Narrow" also means to underestimate and contempt. "Shu-Xian Yi De": "There is no self-expansion but narrow people." Kong Yingdashu: "Don't think that you know is big, and that what you know is small." " Xia" also means urgency and urgency. "The Book of Rites‧The Book of Music": "Broadness is to tolerate traitors, while narrowness is desire." Zheng Xuan's note: "Broadness is that the voice is slow, and narrow is that the voice is urgent." " Narrow" also means narrow-minded or insightful. Jin Gehong's "Baopuzi·Weizhi": "The study of husband affairs is not as good as choosing a teacher. The teacher is very narrow and doesn't want to teach it. The reason is that there is not much to do."

狹字的基本解释

狹
xiá
见“狭”。

狹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiá］
［《廣韻》侯夾切，入洽，匣。］
“夾4”的被通假字。“狭1”的繁体字。
(1)窄。横的距离小。与“宽”、“广”相对。
(2)小；少。
(3)小看；轻视。
(4)指见识或心胸狭隘。
(5)急促；急迫。
(6)迫近；靠近。参见“狹坐”。
(7)不丰裕。
(8)通“俠”。

狹字的康熙字典解释

【巳集下】【犬字部】　狹； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页711第30
【玉篇】下甲切【正韻】胡夾切，?音匣。【玉篇】同狎。今爲闊狹。【書·咸有一德】無自廣以狹人。【釋文】狹，戸夾反。　又【廣韻】侯夾切【集韻】轄夾切，?音洽。【廣韻】隘狹。【禮·禮器】禮之大倫，以地廣狹。【釋文】狹，音洽，又戸夾反。【史記·滑稽傳】臣見其所持者狹，而所欲者奢。

狹字的源字形

暂无。

narrow

narrow
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiá］
["Guang Yun" Hou clip cut, enter into contact, box. ]
"Clip 4" was passed falsely. Traditional Chinese characters for "篠1".
(1) Narrow. The horizontal distance is small. Contrast with "wide" and "wide".
(2) Small; less.
(3) Underestimate; underestimate.
(4) Refers to insight or narrow-mindedness.
(5) Urgent; urgent.
(6) Approaching; approaching. See "Narrow Sitting".
(7) Not rich.
(8) Through "Xia".
narrow
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Part 2] [Dog Character Department] 　 narrow; Kangxi strokes: 11; page number: page 711 30
[Jade articles] Lower nail cut [Zheng Yun] Hu clip cut, sound box. 【Jade articles】Tongxuan. Today is wide and narrow. 【Book·Xianyueyi】There is no self-confidence to narrow people. 【Explanation】Narrow, reversed.　[Guangyun] Hou Jiaqie [Jiyun] Administer Jiaqie,? Yin Qia. [Guangyun] Narrow-minded. 【Rite·Ritual Vessel】The great virtue of ritual is wide and narrow. [Explanation] Narrow, sound, and reverse. [Historical Records·Comical Biography] The ministers saw that they were narrow, but those who wanted to be extravagant.
